intro: Dialyanthera, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or orange flowers that are often clustered in racemes. The plants typically have hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Dialyanthera species are native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Argentina. They are often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
